data.title: draw_line and Sprite3D don't work in HTML5
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Fedora 23, x86_64, Godot Engine  v2.1.stable.official

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Using `draw_line` on a `TextureButton` works improperly when exported to HTML5.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Drawing on `TextureButton` with a script.

    func _draw():
        draw_line(Vector2(3, 3), Vector2(47, 47), Color(0.5, 0, 0, 0.6), 30)
        draw_line(Vector2(3, 47), Vector2(47, 3), Color(0.5, 0, 0, 0.6), 30)

Running the application (good):
![native](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/225232/20556675/75459152-b168-11e6-91a2-dd0fe0f6b0a8.png)

Running the application in Firefox 50.0 after exporting it to HTML5 (bad)
![firefox](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/225232/20556674/75422148-b168-11e6-9cec-9cea194f1347.png)

*Note:* There is no problem with drawing with `draw_primitive()` function.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: Added option to import materials as files instead of binding them to meshes
data.body:
Since importing materials bound to meshes can cause a headache when trying to edit a lot of materials I think it's useful to have an option to import them as materials like most of the other engines do.

Could probably enhance this by enabling the materials to be imported into a subdirectory, maybe add the same for other assets like textures as well to keep the importer from creating a mess.

data.title: Marked as Win32/Heim.C when steam is updating GODOT
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** Windows7, Steam, AVG

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected): When Steam is downloading new GODOT patch, AVG is marking files

godot.windows.opt.tools.32.exe
windows_32_debug.exe
windows_32_release.exe
windows_64_debug.exe
windows_64_release.exe

as infected with [Win32/Heim.C](http://www.avgthreatlabs.com/us-en/virus-and-malware-information/info/win-heim)

Probably false positive, just letting you know. [You can submit false-positive report here](https://secure.avg.com/submit-sample)

![godot_heimc](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4945875/20516801/87a85ae4-b098-11e6-9868-dca983627920.png)

(screenshot is in czech language but i think it is self explanatory)

**Steps to reproduce:**
Steam auto update.

Posibly related with #3665

data.title: Properly localize absolute path that starts with the resource folder.
data.body:
Calling localize_path will return a localized path in `res://` if the path starts with the resource file-system/folder, and will return the unchanged absolute path otherwise.

Closes #6979 .
Closes #7161.

data.title: [gles3] errors
data.body:
Hello!
I tested gles3 branch and have some errors in terminal:

> max ubo light: 409

> max ubo reflections: 455  ubo size: 144
> mesege
> ERROR: _gl_debug_print: GL ERROR: Source: OpenGL        Type: Error     ID: 1286       Severity: High   Message: GL_INVALID_FRAMEBUFFER_OPERATION error generated. Operation is not valid because a bound framebuffer is not framebuffer complete.
>    At: drivers/gles3/rasterizer_gles3.cpp:65.
> 
> 
> mesege
> ERROR: _gl_debug_print: GL ERROR: Source: OpenGL        Type: Performance       ID: 131218      Severity: Medium        Message: Program/shader state performance warning: Fragment Shader is going to be recompiled because the shader key based on GL state mismatches.
>    At: drivers/gles3/rasterizer_gles3.cpp:65.
> 
> ERROR: get: Condition ' !id_map.has(p_rid.get_data()) ' is true. returned: __null
>    At: core/rid.h:166.
> 
> ERROR: material_remove_instance_owner: Condition ' !material ' is true.
>    At: drivers/gles3/rasterizer_storage_gles3.cpp:1719.
> 
> ERROR: get: Condition ' !id_map.has(p_rid.get_data()) ' is true. returned: __null
>    At: core/rid.h:166.
> 
> ERROR: material_remove_instance_owner: Condition ' !material ' is true.
>    At: drivers/gles3/rasterizer_storage_gles3.cpp:1719.

I have this error in a gpu with OpenGL 3.3 and GLES 2 (GLSL ES 1.00) support. Do this branch need complete GLES 3 support for desktop, or only OpenGL 3.3 is sufficient?

data.title: TileMap now honors blending mode.
data.body:
Previously, blending mode was ignored.
I had to make CanvasItem::set_blending_mode virtual, to allow the TileMap refresh.

data.title: Display Live Scene Tree on the Editor
data.body:
Something I really miss on my game design road with Godot Engine is the option to live debug the runtime scene. Currently we have the Remote Inspector, which does 80% of the job. But on dynamic scenes it is not enough.
Sometimes we need to visually pick a specific object and modify it. With the current Live Scene Tree, we have to bruteforce every instance of the object to reach the one we want to modify. 
My proposal is: when we hit "Pause Scene" in the editor, a new scene tab would be created reflecting the Live Scene Tree root node (the viewport with all the child nodes). This way we could visually debug our game and fine tunning some properties this will also enable some new features:

- Be able to save a resource created in runtime, since all the nodes would be instaced on a temporary scene, the Editor Inspector would be avaible so, we could save runtime resources if wanted so.
- Be able to test game stages without manually reproduce'm. Let's say we want to test a moving platform, and see how the player's node react to it. Try some cliff and edge animations, and such. Currently we need to manually put the player's node on the platform's edges, and if it is moving, good lucky to find how you player will behave to this.
-And more

I made a minimal viable project to show the overall concept:
Play the testScene
Press ctrl + enter to pause and save the scene state you want to debug
go the savedScene.tscn and debug it :D
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B4qLEmhydQzlTHY4SUxDZVItRHc/view?usp=sharing
I also made a video, avaible on our facebook group:
https://www.facebook.com/groups/godotengine/permalink/882432988559963/?comment_id=883630085106920&comment_tracking=%7B%22tn%22%3A%22R%22%7D

data.title: Pause scene sometimes not working in the editor
data.body:
**Windows 10 - Godot version:2.1.1 and 2.2 (17/10/2016)**


**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

What happened: when "Play the edited Scene" and try to pause it from the editor, it is not pausing
What was expected: when we hit the Pause Scene button, the runtime scene get paused

**Steps to reproduce:**

Create any scene, specially with Rigidbody2D. 
Instance a Sprite child into the Rigidbody2D. 
Save the scene. 
Hit the "Play the edited scene" button on the editor
Hit the "Pause the Scene" button on the editor
See the Rigidbody2D still processing

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
Just open the "testScene" and try to Steps to reproduce
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B4qLEmhydQzlTHY4SUxDZVItRHc/view?usp=sharing

data.title: Windows Compile Fails With Custom Module
data.body:
**Windows 10 - Godot 2.1.1**
Compiled with Visual Studio 2015, either x86 or x64, Native Tools Command Prompt.  Using Godot Steamworks module.  Godot pulled from branch tag 2.1.1-stable.  Using clean folder.

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When compiled in Linux, exact same module and Godot 2.1.1 branch content, the resulting executable runs fine.  No issues with the editor or Steamworks.

However, when compiling it in Windows, compiling seemingly finishes correctly but the resulting executable does not work, just crashing at boot with this error:
`The procedure entry point SteamInternal_ContextInit could not be located in the dynamic link D:\Projects\Godot\godot.windows.tools.64.exe`
Opening this executable file things like Dependency Walker shows a lot of weird errors like:
`Error: At least one required implicit or forwarded dependency was not found.
Error: At least one module has an unresolved import due to a missing export function in an implicitly dependent module.
Error: Modules with different CPU types were found.`

Custom Steamworks module works fine in compiling with Godot 2.1 and custom compile of Godot 2.1.1 without the module results in a work executable.

TL,DR: 2.1 on Linux and Windows works with module, 2.1.1 does not work with module on Windows, just Linux.  What changed?

**Steps to reproduce:**
Downloaded 2.1.1 stable branch, dropped GodotSteam into the modules folder, then run
`scons platform=windows`
in VS 2015 Native Tools Command Prompt.   Resulting executable does not work.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
Steamworks API for Godot - https://github.com/Gramps/GodotSteam

data.title: Mipmap bug when using imported textures
data.body:
**Windows 10 Home 64-Bits** - Godot Version: **2.1.1-Stable 32-bits** _&_ **2.1-Stable 32-bit**


When using imported textures with the **"no mipmap"** option turned off and specific compression options, I get a black shadow a bit far from camera as seen [**HERE**](https://i.gyazo.com/72c551219ba3aa0025d82d2d786970c7.png).

It doesn't happen when seen from the top, but grows the more aligned the face/polygon is to the camera.

It only happens if you import the textures with the compression option set to Uncrompressed or Compressed(Vram) and with mipmap.

Using the image file directly or importing using the other compression options work as it should, both with mipmaps on.
Deactivating the mipmaps flag after it was imported with vram or uncrompressed also gets rid of the problem but you lose the mipmap effect.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1-Import the texture provided with only **repeat**, **anisotropy**,**fix border** and **filter** flags set to on and compression set to **Vram** or **Uncompressed**.
2-Apply to terrain as diffuse.
3-Run the scene for a FPS view or move camera close to the ground and align to it.

[**Link to minimal example project**](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/11827298/MipmapBug.rar)

data.title: StreamPeerOpenSSL::initialize_ssl loads cert twice
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
x86_64 linux master

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
The ssl .cert file was loaded twice but only needs to be loaded once.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Set the ssl cert and conf setting under project settings.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
Use the HTTPClient to request an https website url.
Set ssl=true,verify=false.

The code is clear enough why it loads twice.  Should the conf setting and cert settings be mutually exclusive? Or should StreamPeerOpenSSL::initialize_ssl use 
```
if(cert) 
    load cert
else
    load cert specified by conf
```

data.title: Added focus tracking in X11 and Windows classes, added new confined mouse mode
data.body:
See [issue #6091](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/6091).

For now this only works on X11, I can look into implementing it on Windows too, should be trivial, unfortunately I don't have a dev environment setup yet. *Bugsquad edit:* Windows implemented.

The focus tracking is needed to disable sending events when window is not in focus, otherwise it makes alt-tabbing for example difficult as you'd need a maximized window to alt tab to to make our window lose focus, if there is none the mouse gets warped making it really hard to get out of the application.

I also disabled motion event propagation when the window isn't focused to prevent relative motion jumps when regaining focus by using the mouse at a different position from the last tracked.

data.title: regression: running godot -e path_to_scene fails to open the scene
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
linux, master

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I think caused by #6813. The path in the parameter is made absolute in main.cpp (around line 1326), the editor later calls Globals::localize_path, which fails to localize the path. I don't know what bug that fixes, but localize path should make the path local to the resource path

**Steps to reproduce:**
run
godot -e scene.scn
from the root of a project

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: Flat button support in ButtonArray. Fixes #7153
data.body:
Since I was working on ButtonArray recently I decided to dive in and do more tweaks. Flat rendering is now supported, fixing #7153

I've also modified the size and spacing of the default theme slightly so it should look almost the same as a list of individual buttons. I think the only visual difference now is the font colour. That said, I'm not entirely sure how people feel about this change.

Before:
![before](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/185322/20456033/dee9c292-aea5-11e6-87f6-5064d2c2bfa9.png)

After:
![after](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/185322/20456035/eb03c44c-aea5-11e6-8b40-4a9b7df0a80b.png)

data.title: <"App name" may slow down your iPhone > warning message on iOS 10.1
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
macOS Sierra 10.12.1, Godot 2.1 stable, Xcode 8.1, iOS 10.1.1, Simulator 10.0


**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
My new app, when first deployed and run on iOS 10.1 device or Simulator, will present the alert message which reads: " 'App name' may slow down you iPhone. The developer of this app needs to update it to improve its compatibility".  After some googling work, I found that it could be the 32 bits issue. But it proves to be of no use even I recompile Godot with 64 bits and export data.pck only 64 bits (not fat mode).

**Steps to reproduce:**
Compile Godot with: "Scons platform=iphone tools=no bits=64 target=release ios_sim=yes" for Simulator and with "Scons platform=iphone tools=no bits=64 target=release" for iDevice. Export data.pck from editor with 64 bits mode.

Thanks for helping!

data.title: Shadows missing in 2.1.1
data.body:

data.title: ButtonArray Flat option
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
OS X - Godot stable 2.1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
ButtonArrays don't seem to have the option to have a "Flat" style like a button does.  It would be good to give them this feature.  Currently we need to make a whole list of individual buttons so they can be "flat" styled.

data.title: Undo in Animation editor does not work after changing script
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 2.1, Linux 64bit

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Undo in Animation editor does not work correctly after changing script. It undo script changes not animation changes.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Make a change in script. Then make a change in animation (tested on: `remove selected track`, `duplicate animation`, `remove animation`). Then Undo. It will undo script changes not animation changes.

data.title: PhysicsBody2D fails to generate collision shapes when the shape is added to a PhysicsBody2D instanced subscene
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10
Godot 2.1.1 stable

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
PhysicsBody2D fails to generate collision shapes when the shape is added to a PhysicsBody2D instanced subscene.
Also creating a subscene with the Shape, Instance it and edit the shape from the Collision shape with editable children doesn't work, the Collision Shape retains the collision from the instance before the edits.
This seems to be a bug, because **the user should expect always a working PhysicsBody2D if they have a children shape.** **Editable children flag in the subscene doesn't fix the issue.**

In my game I want a generic collider with a script which only objetive is to damage enemies or player, the main requirement is this collider should have different shapes, for example a bullet could be a circle shape or  a big rectangle, etc. So I created an Area2D subscene with my script without a shape, and my plan is to add custom shapes to subscene **instances**. That idea failed when the engine failed to create the collision shapes in this case.

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Create a PhysicsBody2D node (Area2D, RigidBody2d, StaticBody2D, etc)
- Make that PhysicsBody2D a subscene but **don't add a Collision Shape**
- Instance the subscene and add a CollisionShape to the instance, not the subscene

**Link to minimal example project**:
Press play and wait for rigid bodies to collide with floor, subscene ones don't collide:
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/s/ffi6rapu9co0p7m/custom_collision_shape.zip

data.title: Asset Library should be able to filter plugins by compatibility with engine version
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 2.1.1-Stable

**Issue description** 
It is possible to download templates/demos/plugins that won't work for your Godot version, there are no warning or filters that hide non compatible projects. 

**Steps to reproduce:**
 - Download and install Cute 3D Multiplayer Third Person Shooter from the Project Manager's template tab.
 - You won't get any warning saying that it does not works on your Godot version.
 - Try to edit and run the project.

ps: I don't like the idea of compulsive version filter but at least a warning should be there.
